overview_of_class: This course is a comparative study of famines, particularly as an intended weapon in a war, used against a competing political faction or part of empire. We will investigate how and why democracies are beset by droughts, but do not experience famines, looking at a range of countries, from Ethiopia and India to China and Ireland. The work of Nobel Prize-winning economist Amartya Sen, among others, will be covered. This course fulfills the 300-level course requirement for both History and Political Science majors.
name: Special Topics in International Studies
